item.description:
I thought it would be fun to get together and have a traditional Thanksgiving dinner. So, we're going to have it at one of the oldest establishments in Boston. "Durgin-Park is a centuries-old restaurant at Faneuil Hall Marketplace and it has been a "landmark since 1827."

"In keeping with its long history, the concept of Durgin-Park maintains the tradition of communal seating at long tables. The menu is designed to offer traditional New England-style fare." It is well know for its waitstaff to be rude and talk back to the customer. This is part of the whole experience.

On Thanksgiving, Durgin Park will have a turkey dinner, a ham dinner, and a sea food dinner. The dinners range from $19.99 (for the ham) to $35.99 (for the seafood). Turkey dinner is $24.99. This cost is for the whole meal not just an entree. I will send out more specifics about the menus when I get that information.

Durgin Park is accessible by T: Green or Blue Line to Government Center, Green or Orange Line to Haymarket, or Blue Line to Aquarium. There is also parking under Boston Commons for $11/day on weekend and week days after 4pm.

I will allow maybe RSVPs for now, but will change the maybes to nos closer to the day of the event.

group.name: The Boston Euro Social Meetup Group

item.name: Thanksgiving Dinner
